sentences: Woo Ji-ho (Korean: 우지호; born September 14, 1992), better known by his stage name Zico (Korean: 지코), is a South Korean rapper, record producer, singer and songwriter.
section: N/A

sentences: He debuted as the leader of the boy band Block B in 2011 and made his first solo release in 2014.
section: N/A

sentences: Zico is notable for his crossover skills within the Korean hip hop scene, maintaining an underground reputation along with mainstream appeal as a Korean idol.
section: N/A

sentences: He is a record producer of both K-pop and Korean hip hop music.
section: N/A

sentences: He is also part of the crew Fanxy Child, which he formed in 2016.
section: N/A

sentences: In 2019, he released his first full-length solo album, Thinking.
section: N/A

sentences: Early life and career beginnings ==
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: Zico was born in Dohwa, Seoul on September 14, 1992.

sentences: He was a Vocal Performance major at Seoul Music High School.
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: In the lyrics of his song "Release", he mentions that he spent a year studying abroad in both Canada and China, as well as three years in Japan.
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: Meanwhile, he had referred to his time in Japan within his song "Osaka" with fellow Korean musician ELO.
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: He began his musical career as an underground rapper, going by the name "Nacseo" (Hangul: 낙서), meaning 'doodle' or 'scribble' in Korean.
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: He promoted as Nacseo in the Japanese underground hip hop scene alongside the crews "Dope Squad" and "Undisputed".
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: He auditioned for SM Entertainment as a teenager.
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: In 2009, he officially debuted in a duo with Park Kyung named 'Harmonics' in Korea with the digital single "The Letter".
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: He joined Stardom Entertainment in 2009.
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: He featured in IU's song "Marshmallow" as well as Cho PD's "Expectations for K-Hip Hop" and Jung Seul-gi's "Outsiders".
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: In 2010, he released his first mixtape, Zico on the Block.
section: == Early life and career beginnings ==

sentences: The mixtape was well received by the Korean hip hop scene.

sentences: === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: In January 2019, it was announced that Zico had established his own label, KOZ Entertainment.

sentences: Zico is planning to use his label to develop other artists as well as his own career.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: On March 2, 2019, it was announced that the mayor of Seoul, Park Won-soon, would appoint Zico as a goodwill representative for the city.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: In August, the hip-hop crew Fanxy Child, consisting of Zico, Dean, Crush, Penomeco, Millic and Staytuned, held two sold-out concerts in Seoul, coinciding with the release of the crew's single, "Y."On September 30, 2019, the digital EP Thinking Part.1 was released as the first half of the two-part studio album, titled Thinking.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: The second half of the studio album Thinking Part.2 was released on November 8, 2019.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: On January 13, 2020, Zico released the single "Any Song".
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: The song achieved an "all-kill", topping all Korean real-time digital charts.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: In addition, the song gained popularity on the video sharing app TikTok with the hashtag "Any Song Challenge"; the challenge has been credited with restoring TikTok's popularity in Korea.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: On July 9, the Gaon Music Chart certified "Any Song" as platinum in streaming and listed the song as the most-streamed in Korea for the first half of 2020.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: On July 1, Zico released his third EP Random Box, with its title track "Summer Hate" featuring Rain.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: It was announced on July 21 that Zico would begin the conscription required of South Korean men from July 30.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: He is expected to serve for two years as a public service worker.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: On November 18, 2020, it was announced that HYBE Corporation, formerly Big Hit Entertainment, would acquire Zico's production company KOZ Entertainment, which launched in January 2019.
section: == Career == | === 2019–present: KOZ Entertainment, Thinking, "Any Song," Random Box, and conscription ===

sentences: Since April 2021, after the rebranding of KOZ's parent company, HYBE Corporation, the company became part of HYBE Labels, Hybe's entertainment and music production division.

sentences: KOZ Entertainment, as well as its sister companies, work independently from HYBE while receiving creative support.

== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Zico is a devout Roman Catholic with his baptismal name "John the Apostle" tattooed on his chest, along with a portrait of his mother and below it the phrase "God save Paulus".
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He also has an older brother, Woo Tae-woon, who was a former member of idol group Speed.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Zico studied at the Dong-Ah Institute of Media and Arts University (a technical college specializing in media design, production, and communications) between 2013 – February 13, 2015.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Zico began his mandatory military service on July 30, 2020.
